Comment: You're right there were more issues, but this one was definitely a big one Harris should've broken off of Biden from. It was easy votes to win over.  The uncommitted movement, that specifically went to the primaries to vote uncommitted as a protest against Biden's Gaza policies, had 100,000 uncommitted votes in Michigan. Trump won Michigan by ~80,000 votes.   It was a very clear issue people cared about for obvious reasons. Instead of trying to win these easy votes, like with many issues, Harris refused to break away with Biden and say she'd do things differently. This overall attitude of not trying to win over every last vote is what lost the election and democrats seemingly haven't learned anything based on how they're talking about the AOC/Bernie tour
Author: KDLCum

Comment: Comparing primary political stunts to a presidential election is very much apples to oranges, but I absolutely understand what you're saying. The problem that I think a lot of the pro-gaza crowd run into is that, for a lot of people who are struggling, hearing that people won't vote to help them over some war half a world away hurts. It hurts that it sucks up all of the oxygen in the room in progressive spaces. There's massive political stunts and tons of money and attention thrown at this war we aren't even a belligerent in, when women, black people, Hispanic people, and queer people are being trampled on. A lot of women especially, me included, feel justifiably grossed out when we see people who pick for their first priority something almost as far from us as it can be on earth when the crackdown on our rights has continued largely unabated. You're not going to win anyone to your cause by placing Gaza over people's bills, or their basic civil rights
Author: Intelligent-Time9911
